page.title: 06LAW & ORDER LINCOLNSHIRE
page.content: Lincolnshire Police H.Q.off Deepdale Lane was opened in 1981 by Queen Elizabeth,who travelled to Lincoln by train.The H.Q. employs 200 civilians and approx 100 police are based there,headed by The Chief Constable.There are 260 vehicles & 12-14 dogs around the county,dogs being trained nearby Grange-de-Lings. There is a large computer for data storage.Shifts are from 6.00am-2.00pm, 2.00pm-10.00pm,10.00pm-6.00am.Sports facilities include a gym,tennis,squash and badminton courts and a snooker table.Male recruits have a min.height of 5ft 8ins,females 5ft 4ins.The H.Q. is for Admin,Training and Vehicle Workshops.The shooting range in the basement is for Training including the use of live ammunition.Sports grounds surround the buildings,which are dominated by a communication tower
